Office of the Assistant Principal (Registrar)
Jenny Share (ext. 104) Assistant Principal (Registrar)

Jenny is responsible for the strategic management and development of Registry Services, Student Support and International Office functions. With regard to Registry Services, she is responsible for the overall management and development of student record systems, the academic year calendar, the maintenance of academic regulations, appeals/plagiarism, servicing of College committees, administration of the committee structure and University of Leeds liaison. She is also Secretary to the Academic Board.
Lucy is the secretary to the Assistant Principal (Registrar) and deals with the administration of College committees and degree ceremonies.

Registry Services, situated in AM36, is responsible for the central administration of all student records, and for providing related services and support to students and staff. The Registry Services team deals with a range of matters from application and induction through to examination, results confirmation and graduation, including the following:
All staff are involved in the operation of key Registry Services events such as clearing, post-application days, registration and examinations.

All information held within student records is covered by the Data Protection Act (see Policy Statements). You are responsible for ensuring that your personal information held by the College is accurate and up-to-date. You should, therefore, notify Registry Services immediately of any change in personal details. Contact addresses and telephone numbers are particularly important in case of emergency. When visiting Registry Services or collecting exam results, you will be required to show your student card as a means of ID.

R

egistry Services is normally open from 09:00 to 17:00 (Monday ¡V Thursday) and 09.00 ¡V 16.00 (Friday).
Further information can be found on our web site:
Elaine has overall responsibility for development and efficient running of the department in order to support corporate objectives. Elaine is a member of the Registry Services Senior Team.

Emma is responsible for managing and leading a team of staff involved in carrying out the day-to-day execution of Registry Services duties. She liaises with, and provides advice to, academic staff, SMT and administrative departments, applicants, schools/colleges, UCAS/GTTR, local education authorities and other government bodies. Emma is a member of the Registry Services Senior Team

Elaine is responsible for ensuring the smooth and efficient use and development of the student records system, for facilitating the extensive and enhanced use of the system across the College and for ensuring that key policies and procedures are appropriately supported by it. She ensures that the academic portfolio of the College is accurately represented both electronically and in published material (eg on the web and in the Handbook of Modular Degree Programmes). Elaine is a member of the Registry Services Senior Team.

Phil is responsible for ensuring that the information needs of the College and external bodies are met, and that institutional policies and processes with regard to information are within current legislation. He is responsible for the production of internal management information, standard institutional statistical reports and statistical returns for external bodies as required (eg HEFCE, HESA, and QAA). Phil also acts as the College Data Protection and Freedom of Information Officer. Phil is a member of the Registry Services Senior Team.

Jon is responsible for providing administrative and technical support to the operations of Registry Services, including registration, records, examinations, production of certification of student status and management reporting.

Julie is responsible for providing support to all matters relating to the undergraduate modular system, including the maintenance of student records and the production of modular schedules, transcripts and reports. Julie works mornings only Monday to Friday (09.15 - 13.15)

Clare is responsible for the processing and notification of student withdrawals and programme transfers and for the administration of examination papers and other examination-related matters. She is also responsible for the production of certificates, non-modular transcripts and circulation of College term dates.
Sarah is responsible for all matters relating to the administration of postgraduate, PGCE and visiting students, including student records, registration and examination.
Diane and Emma are responsible for the administration of undergraduate admissions, processing applications, arranging post application days and providing support to clearing.

Responsible for the administration of student loan matters and provides general support to the other areas of Registry Services such as registration, examination and student record matters. Please contact Jon Allott (ext.120)with regards to student loans until further notice.
Anne is responsible for the administration of PGCE and postgraduate admissions, and provides support to undergraduate admissions, clearing and post-application days.
Hannah Brown and Jacky Taylor (ext.197) Administrative Assistant (Timetabling)

Hannah and Jacky produce the College Academic timetable in consultation with senior members of staff. They co-ordinate the weekly timetabling and room bookings during term-time. (Weekend and vacation bookings are dealt with by Commercial Services).
